title: Joe Allen insists Stoke City players behind under-pressure Nathan Jones after last-gasp Swansea win
text:
Joe Allen believes Nathan Jones is the man to lead the Stoke City ­revival and insists the players are behind him as they claimed an against-the-odds 2-1 win at high-flying Swansea City.

Things looked bleak for the Championship’s bottom side after Andre Ayew’s first Liberty Stadium goal since 2016 came within the first minute, before former Swansea misfit Sam Clucas equalised.

Jones was on the brink before Scott Hogan helped him earn a stay of execution with a late goal to give Stoke hope that they can turn their disastrous start to the season around.

“A lot has been said so far this season for obvious reasons, but today’s performance says all you need to know about what we’re willing to give for the manager and his staff,” said former Swansea midfielder ­Allen. “But, having said that, we’re conscious it’s only one win. But hopefully it can be a catalyst to kick-start our season.

“We have a lot of ground to make up and we need to get a lot more points on the board. Everyone can understand the frustration and disappointment because it’s almost impossible to put your finger on what’s gone wrong for us this season.
description: Joe Allen believes Nathan Jones is the man to lead the Stoke City ­revival and insists the players are behind him as they claimed an against-the-odds 2-1 win at high-flying Swansea City.
